comment: Professor Napshin is an okay professor. I do not feel like I learned anything from taking his to manage your company class. We are mostly given busy work. I have an A in the class currently, but I wish he had given less busy work at the beginning of the semester and spread out his excel assignments.

Stuart is a hard grader. I wouldn't recommend this professor unless you're ready to put in extra effort, assignments are due early in the week. He attempts to prepare you for the “real world.” No tests but there's a price to pay for that.
he is a tough grader
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Napshin is a tough professor.  I learned a lot though.  I'm sending this after I have already gotten a job and realize how much he taught me I am now using in my new job.  Now I wish I had pad more attention. I did well but I also worked pretty hard.  It was one of my last classes at KSU.  This is not an easy A but it's worth the time.

It seems like a lot in the beginning but I'm telling you, ask for 1:1 help from the professor, he will help you! I struggled with this class but came out with an A at the end. I'm NOT good at math at all but going directly to him will save yourself, trust me! He only communicates via Teams & ended up omitting some of our assignments.

This is the worst professor I have had in my 5 years at KSU. I did not graduate because on the last day he dropped my grade from a B+ to a D+ without any explanation or reasoning.  Also, He will openly mock you in class in front of everyone if he does not like you. I failed my attendance grade due to not coming because of this, but KSU doesn't care
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He was aight. Helpful but goodluck...

The first half of the semester, he was a little difficult, but if you hang in there it gets easier. As long as you try and come to him for help, you will get a good grade. Very Excel heavy, complained about it at first, but now I appreciate it. Im waayyy more confident in my skills in Excel. No textbook so that's great! NO EXAMS OR QUIZZES!

If you have a Youtube channel, and are familiar with making movies and presentations, then he's your guy. Must be somewhat familiar with Excel as well. I am 30+ years old with a full time job and a family, so the Youtube thing is not my area of expertise. Class is informative, but the weekly videos you must post are a little over the top.

Napshins class was very Excel heavy and the work load was a lot. However, he is extremely helpful (you just have to reach out and talk to him) and very knowledgeable about the subject he teaches. The Excel work has translated to my current career, and the extra reading regarding personal finances is much more useful than you think at the time!

He gave me a 0 on a quiz because I didnt take it seriously enough. I suggest not taking him if possible. No grading criteria. Too much needless work. Doesnt explain anything. I dont think he has any real world experience with a company he just teaches based off what he thinks is important, not actual standards or company opinions

This is one of the few classes I actually learned useful material for the future, but it came with a price. Heavy workload each week. If you have a full-time job or taking a lot of classes, then this class will probably stress you out. Easily the most work I had to do for a class in my four years of college. Lots of projects and Excel work weekly.

I do not understand why this man got so many good reviews, he's unclear, he gives tons and tons of work. He gave more work per week then the rest of my classes combined. He treats this class like its your only one , and even though all of your work can be done by yourself at home he makes you come to class and sit there and do it, and looks over u.

Professor Napshin is solid. He has a very affable personality and is not afraid to have fun in class. I took him for my capstone class in the MBA program and it was a very good experience. He thoroughly cares about his students success while realizing that folks are balancing work and life, especially at the MBA level. I would recommend him for all

He is a funny man which makes class more enjoyable. He is very experienced at excel. I love that he is flexible and know that we all learn at different paces. This is one of the more difficult classes I have, and Napshin did his very best for teaching excel to the majority of us who only know the basics! Take him! You will learn a lot from him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Napshin is definitely a wonderful professor! He knows the subject of strategy really well. This has by far one of the most challenging courses for me in my undergraduate degree and I can honestly say it has been a great class!  Thanks Professor Napshin for making this interactive class and hands on, Kamal
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: This class was more difficult than previous students rated. However, I grew as an individual and I can honestly say I learned something. Participation is key but he also helps you out by calling on you. This was intimidating at first but it truly engages you. I enjoyed the in class activities with my classmates they were relatable to class topic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Napshin did a great job for our 2016 Strategy class. He helped me focus on how to apply the course to my business and really has impacted my view on business strategy and how important it is for success. Take this professor and if your open he will really teach you something useful.

Napshin does use Connect for his homework assignments which is why i would be hesitant to take him again. Beware of the first introduction day, he doesn't really describe what the class will be like and will leave you wondering.  Otherwise, he has very interesting and engaging lectures and the exams are part take home + in class (notes + quizzes).

He's a good teacher but he can be confusing at most! One midterm, connect homework dont miss those or you will fail, and a final which was optional if you made a great attempt on the connect homeworks. Expect to participate in group discussions and he doesnt play about participation grade he is very tough on that so prepare to engage him in class

He is a good professor. You have to buy the e-book and do connect assignments, but there are no tests. Every class is interactive and if you don't at least chime in with a comment once per class it will have a huge effect on your grade.. The midterm and term project are huge papers that require a lot of work. Work hard + attend every class  A

You must talk every class if you want to get a good grade. He plays favorites and will make snide comments about others. There were 2 tests which were papers on certain businesses. Participation makes up about 13 of your grade and there is some connect problems. Take the course online, not much value in it, or with the professor.
Great Professor over all. Consistent and demands a lot from his students. Come to class, be prepared and you will learn more from his class than you ever would.

Take him if you want the knowledge that will carry with you throughout your professional life.  He's probably the best to learn for this subject.  If you want an easy A, go for someone else.  Workload is a lot, but is relevant to the class.  One last tip, if you have a full course load for the semester, I suggest you wait on taking this class.

The materials and the activities are well aligned. His grading isn't well aligned at time, than can sometimes confuse students. There is plenty of work. He is a much better teacher than Tim. Take him.

Professor Napshin is an AWESOME professor! He is reasonable and a very down to earth professor. Don’t be intimidated by him..he is nice but you must do your work and attend class. Great teaching style and does a lot of hands-on activities to help students understand strategies and concepts.TAKE HIM! An A is in reach just do what is expected of you.

Napshin is a good choice for the MBA Capstone course. Lectures generally involve team exercises. This class requires you to stay on top of coursework (other than the book which was never used) or you will fall behind. Make sure you learn CAPSIM thoroughly as early as possible and you'll do fine. He offers extra credit opportunities as well.

Awesome professor...If you want to learn strategy, take this professor. He knows the material very well and although it seems tough to start stick with it and you will do fine. Not an easy A, but go to class, do your work and you will succeed.
He's the best teacher ever...a smooth and delightful blend of Socrates and Frederich Taylor.  Take him if you have the opportunity!
